meals.meal: Marinated Pork Tenderloin with Roasted Sweet Potato
Lemon Herb Chicken with Roasted Asparagus
Crockpot Italian Sausage & Peppers over Rice
GF Fettuccine Alfredo with Garlic Butter Broccoli

recipes.name: Steak Fajita Rice Bowls
ingredients: 3/4 lb flank or skirt steak, sliced thin
1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, salt & pepper
Toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa, avocado, lime
recipes.instructions: Sear steak strips 2-3 min over high heat, remove. Saute peppers and onions 5 min. Serve over rice with toppings.
prepSteps: Start rice: Begin cooking rice according to package directions (about 20 min).
Prep steak: Slice steak against the grain into thin strips. Season with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Prep veggies: Slice bell pepper into strips. Slice onion into half-moons.

Sear steak: Heat a large skillet or cast iron over high heat until smoking. Add a little oil, then steak strips. Sear 2-3 minutes, stirring once. Don't overcrowd — cook in batches if needed. Remove to a plate.
Cook veggies: In the same pan, add peppers and onions. Cook 5 minutes until slightly charred and tender-crisp.
Combine: Add steak back to pan with veggies. Toss briefly to combine.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice among bowls. Top with fajita steak and veggies, cheese, sour cream, salsa, avocado, and a squeeze of lime.
tips: Slice steak against the grain for tender bites
Get the pan very hot before adding steak — you want a sear, not steam
Let steak rest 5 minutes before slicing if cooking whole first

recipes.name: Chicken Burrito Bowls
ingredients: 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, salt & pepper
recipes.instructions: Season and saute chicken 6-7 min. Serve over rice with beans, corn, and toppings.
prepSteps: Start rice: Begin cooking rice according to package directions (about 20 min).
Prep chicken: Dice chicken breast into bite-sized cubes. Season with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook chicken: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 6-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.
Prep toppings: While chicken cooks, drain and rinse black beans, warm corn, dice avocado, chop cilantro.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice among bowls. Top with chicken, black beans, corn, salsa, sour cream, cheese, avocado, and cilantro.
tips: Cut chicken into even-sized pieces for consistent cooking
For extra flavor, cook black beans with a little cumin
Add a squeeze of lime juice for brightness

recipes.name: Marinated Pork Tenderloin with Roasted Sweet Potato
ingredients: Marinade: 3 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp brown sugar, 1 tsp Dijon, 1 Tbsp tamari, 1/2 tsp lemon zest, 1 tsp each parsley & thyme, 1/2 tsp garlic, salt & pepper
2 medium sweet potatoes, cubed, tossed with olive oil, salt, pepper
recipes.instructions: Marinate 1-8 hrs. Grill or saute to 145F (~15 min). Rest 5 min. Roast sweet potatoes at 400F for 25 min.
prepSteps: Make marinade: Whisk together olive oil, brown sugar, Dijon, tamari, lemon zest, parsley, thyme, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Marinate pork: Place tenderloin in a bag or dish. Pour marinade over. Refrigerate 1-8 hours (longer = more flavor).
Prep sweet potatoes: Peel and cube sweet potatoes into 1-inch pieces. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast potatoes: Spread on a baking sheet. Roast at 400F for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and tender.
Cook pork: Remove pork from marinade. Grill over medium-high heat or pan-sear, turning occasionally, until internal temp reaches 145F (about 15-20 minutes total).
Rest and slice: Let pork rest 5 minutes. Slice into medallions.
Serve: Plate sliced pork with roasted sweet potatoes.
tips: Don't skip the rest — it keeps the pork juicy
Use a meat thermometer for perfect doneness (145F)
Marinade works great on chicken too

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Chicken with Roasted Asparagus
ingredients: 2 Tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 1 tsp dried oregano, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt & pepper
1 bunch asparagus, trimmed, tossed with olive oil, salt, pepper
recipes.instructions: Marinate chicken 30 min. Sear in skillet 5-6 min per side. Roast asparagus at 400F for 12 min.
prepSteps: Marinate chicken: Mix olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Coat chicken thighs and let sit 30 minutes (or up to 4 hours in fridge).
Prep asparagus: Trim woody ends from asparagus. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet.
Roast asparagus: Roast at 400F for 10-12 minutes until tender with slightly crispy tips.
Sear chicken: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add a little oil. Cook chicken 5-6 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through (internal temp 165F).
Rest: Let chicken rest 3-5 minutes before serving.
Serve: Plate chicken with roasted asparagus. Drizzle with any pan juices.
tips: Pound chicken to even thickness for consistent cooking
Asparagus thickness varies — thin spears need less time
Add lemon zest to the marinade for extra brightness

recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowls
ingredients: Sauce: 3 Tbsp GF soy sauce/tamari, 1 Tbsp honey, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp cornstarch + 1 Tbsp water
1 cup steamed broccoli or snap peas
recipes.instructions: Saute chicken 6 min, add sauce, cook until thickened. Serve over rice with veggies. Top with sesame seeds and green onion.
prepSteps: Start rice: Cook rice according to package directions (about 20 min).
Make sauce: Whisk together tamari, honey, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. In a separate small bowl, mix cornstarch with water to make a slurry.
Prep chicken: Slice chicken thighs into thin strips.
Cook chicken: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat with a little oil. Add chicken strips, cook 5-6 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Add sauce: Pour teriyaki sauce into pan. Add cornstarch slurry. Stir constantly until sauce thickens and coats the chicken, about 1-2 minutes.
Steam veggies: Steam broccoli or snap peas 4-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice among bowls. Top with teriyaki chicken and steamed veggies. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
tips: Slice chicken while partially frozen for easier thin cuts
Make cornstarch slurry right before using — it settles quickly
For crispier chicken, cook in batches and don't crowd the pan

recipes.name: Crockpot Italian Sausage & Peppers over Rice
ingredients: 1 lb Italian sausage links (GF — check label)
1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, salt & pepper
recipes.instructions: Place sausage, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and seasoning in slow cooker. Cook LOW 6 hrs. Slice sausage. Serve over rice.
prepSteps: Morning (10 min): Place Italian sausage links in slow cooker. Add sliced bell peppers and onion on top.
Add sauce: Pour diced tomatoes (with juice) over everything. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook: Cover and cook on LOW for 6 hours or HIGH for 3 hours.
Start rice: About 30 minutes before serving, cook rice according to package directions.
Slice sausage: Remove sausage links and slice into rounds. Return to slow cooker and stir with peppers and sauce.
Serve: Spoon sausage, peppers, and sauce over rice.
tips: Brown sausage first for extra flavor (optional but worth it)
Use a mix of bell pepper colors for visual appeal
Great over pasta or crusty bread too

recipes.name: GF Fettuccine Alfredo with Garlic Butter Broccoli
ingredients: 2 Tbsp butter, 1 cup heavy cream, 1 clove garlic minced
recipes.instructions: Melt butter, saute garlic 30 sec, add cream, simmer 3 min. Stir in Parmesan until smooth. Toss with cooked GF pasta. Steam or roast broccoli on the side.
prepSteps: Boil water: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil for pasta.
Prep broccoli: Cut broccoli into florets. Either steam (5 min) or roast at 425F with olive oil, salt, pepper (15 min).
Cook pasta: Add GF fettuccine to boiling water. Cook according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
Make sauce: While pasta cooks, melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic, saute 30 seconds until fragrant. Pour in heavy cream, bring to a gentle simmer for 3 minutes.
Finish sauce: Remove pan from heat. Stir in grated Parmesan until melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
Combine: Toss drained pasta with sauce. Add splash of pasta water if too thick. Serve immediately with broccoli on the side.
tips: Don't boil the cream — keep it at a gentle simmer to prevent separating
Freshly grated Parmesan melts better than pre-shredded
GF pasta can get gummy — don't overcook, taste test early

Pantry / Dry Goods.item: Cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, oregano, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper
